explanation:
You must inspect these symbols to decide whether reply_with_auth_required can (indirectly) call itself:

- MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls: callee of MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (which reply_with_auth_required calls). Its implementation may invoke user-supplied free callbacks or other code paths that could reach back into application code; we need to confirm it does not call reply_with_auth_required.

- MHD_str_equal_caseless_: callee of MHD_add_response_header. Although a simple utility, include it to rule out any surprising callback/side-effect that could lead back to application code.

- add_response_header_connection: callee of MHD_add_response_header. It manipulates connection/response state and could call other library hooks; include to verify no path to reply_with_auth_required.

- add_response_entry: callee of MHD_add_response_header. Similar reason as above — internal helper that might trigger callbacks into application code.

- MHD_get_response_element_n_: callee of MHD_add_response_header. Include to ensure it does not directly or indirectly call back into reply_with_auth_required.

- queue_auth_required_response3_inner: callee of MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 (which reply_with_auth_required calls). This inner routine may perform operations (including invoking authentication callbacks or queueing code) that could eventually invoke application request handlers; inspect it for any path back to reply_with_auth_required.

- __builtin_unreachable: callee of MHD_destroy_response. Included for completeness because MHD_destroy_response appears in the call chain; while this builtin is not a source of recursion, listing it documents the full transitive callee set to be checked.

- handle_sec_areas_req: caller of reply_with_auth_required. Include this because an indirect recursion could occur if any callee of reply_with_auth_required eventually calls into handle_sec_areas_req (or other callers of reply_with_auth_required), forming a cycle reply_with_auth_required -> ... -> handle_sec_areas_req -> reply_with_auth_required. You must inspect whether any of the transitive callees above can reach handle_sec_areas_req.

In short: inspect the transitive callees of reply_with_auth_required (the listed symbols) and verify none of them — directly or via further calls — can reach handle_sec_areas_req or reply_with_auth_required itself.
